neck.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird
neck.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape (=back) of her neck.
The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff (=back) of the neck into the house.
Jean wore a string of pearls around her neck.
neck.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the part of a piece of clothing that goes around your neck
neck.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The sweater has a round neck and long sleeves.
The neck of his shirt was open.
neck.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the narrow part of something, usually at the top
neck.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: a crack in the neck of the violin
Lara put the cork back in the neck of the bottle.
neck.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a confident attitude that makes you able to do unreasonable or shocking things without feeling embarrassed
neck.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I don't know how they have the neck to charge that much!
neck.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a narrow piece of land that comes out of a wider part
neck.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: a neck of land between a lake and the sea
neck.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if two people are necking, they kiss for a long time in a sexual way
